workflow.name: Automated Slack-to-Jira issue creation with attachments
workflow.description:
## Description
Automatically convert structured Slack messages into Jira issues with parsed titles, descriptions, and priorities. This workflow also downloads file attachments from Slack (e.g., screenshots, logs, or documents) and uploads them directly into the created Jira issue. It then confirms success back to the Slack channel, ensuring transparency and seamless collaboration. üìãüí¨üìé

## What This Template Does
- Monitors a designated Slack channel for new issue reports. üîî
- Parses Slack message text with regex to extract title, description, priority, and type. üß†
- Creates a new Jira issue with the structured data. üé´
- Detects and processes attachments, splitting multiple files into batches. üìÇ
- Downloads files from Slack using secure URLs and Slack bot authentication. üîë
- Uploads attachments directly into the created Jira issue. üìé
- Sends a Slack confirmation with Jira issue key, link, and summary details. ‚úÖ

## Key Benefits
- Eliminates manual Jira ticket creation from Slack messages. ‚è±Ô∏è
- Preserves critical context by attaching screenshots, logs, and documentation. üìé
- Ensures structured, standardized issue reporting across teams. üîÑ
- Provides instant Slack confirmation with direct Jira links. üì≤
- Handles multiple attachments gracefully with batch processing. ‚ö°

## Features
- Slack Trigger ‚Äì Monitors specific channels for new issue messages. üí¨
- Message Parsing Engine ‚Äì Extracts title, description, priority, and type using regex + fallback logic. üìù
- Jira Integration ‚Äì Creates structured Jira issues with proper fields (summary, description, priority, type). üé´
- Attachment Handling ‚Äì Splits, downloads, and uploads Slack files into Jira automatically. üìÇ
- Slack Confirmation ‚Äì Sends formatted success messages with clickable Jira links. üîó
- Robust Data Handling ‚Äì Supports rich text, multiple files, and smart mappings of Slack priorities to Jira. üß†

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Slack Bot API credentials with channels:history, files:read, and chat:write permissions.
- Jira Software Cloud API credentials with project and issue creation permissions.
- Pre-configured Slack channel for reporting issues.
- Jira project set up with supported issue types (bug, task, feature, etc.).

## Target Audience
- Software development teams managing issue intake from Slack. üë©‚Äçüíª
- QA and testing teams reporting bugs directly from Slack. üß™
- IT support teams needing structured Jira issues with attachments. üõ†Ô∏è
- Agile teams looking for seamless Slack ‚Üí Jira integration. üöÄ
- Remote teams requiring real-time visibility into Jira issue creation. üåê

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect Slack and Jira credentials in n8n. üîë
- Configure the Slack channel ID to listen for issue reports. üí¨
- Map Jira project and issue type IDs in the ‚ÄúCreate Jira Issue‚Äù node. üé´
- Customize parsing logic for message formats (default: Title: X, Description: Y, Priority: Z). üìù
- Ensure Slack files can be downloaded with your bot token (files:read scope). üìÇ
- Test with a sample message containing a title, description, and attachment. ‚úÖ
- Deploy and monitor Slack ‚Üí Jira issue creation in real-time. ‚ö°

workflow.name: Automated Slack-to-Jira Issue Creation with Attachments

parameters.content:
Purpose: Attaches downloaded files to created Jira issue

Function: Uploads binary file data to 
specific Jira ticket

Use Case: Preserves screenshots/documentation from Slack in Jira

Input: Jira issue key + file binary data
Result: File becomes viewable in Jira issue

Purpose: Downloads files from Slack using private URLs

Function: Fetches attachment data with Slack bot token authentication

Use Case: Retrieves screenshots/files to attach to Jira issue
Authentication: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE in header

Response: File data in binary format

Purpose: Creates new Jira issue with parsed data

Function: Submits ticket to specified Jira project.

Use Case: Automatically creates trackable issues from Slack reports

Output: Jira issue details including unique issue key

Purpose: Extracts structured issue details from Slack message text

Function: Uses regex to parse Title, Description, Priority from message

Use Case: Converts "Title: X Description: Y Priority: Z" format to structured data
Key Features:

Extracts title, description, priority using regex patterns
Maps Slack priorities (high/medium/low) to Jira format

Purpose: Monitors specific Slack channel for new messages

Function: Automatically triggers workflow when message posted

Use Case: Captures issue reports from  channel.

Configuration: Listens for message events only

Output: Raw Slack message data with text, user, files, timestamps

Purpose: Sends confirmation message back to Slack

Function: Posts success notification in tickets channel

Use Case: Confirms issue creation and provides Jira tracking info

Purpose: Splits multiple attachments into individual items for processing

Function: Loops through each attachment one by one

Use Case: Handles multiple file uploads from Slack message

Output: Individual attachment items that can be processed sequentially

NEW: Splits all files into individual batches

Purpose: Processes each attachment separately

Function: Takes files array and creates one execution per file

Benefit: Enables uploading multiple attachments to Jira

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
